lv.lumii.layoutengine

Class AbstractContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Element
      • lv.lumii.layoutengine.AbstractContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Container, Label

    public abstract class AbstractContainer
extends Element
    The AbstractContainer class specifies a group of diagram elements, though it allows only labels to be added to the group.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double point,
                        double epsilon)
        Finds whether the point lies inside the bounds of the container rectangle, including sides. Use strictContains(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double) to exclude sides.
        Parameters:
        point - the point to check
        epsilon - the width of a buffer around the container rectangle points in which are also considered to be contained by it
        Returns:
        whether the point lies inside the bounds of the container rectangle.

      • createInsideLabel

        public InsideLabel createInsideLabel(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                                     double spacing)
        Creates a new inside label as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new label is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new label
        spacing - the spacing value for the new label
        Returns:
        the new inside label object.

      • createInsideLabel

        public InsideLabel createInsideLabel(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                                     LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType constraintType,
                                     double spacing)
        Creates a new inside label as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new label is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new label
        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the new label
        spacing - the spacing value for the new label
        Returns:
        the new inside label object.

      • createInsideLabel

        public InsideLabel createInsideLabel(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                                     LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType constraintType,
                                     double spacing,
                                     java.lang.Integer row,
                                     java.lang.Integer column)
        Creates a new inside label as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new label is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new label
        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the new label
        spacing - the spacing value for the new label
        row - the row of the new label in this container's grid
        column - the column of the new label in this container's grid
        Returns:
        the new inside label object.

      • findNextRectangleEnclosingRectangle

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double findNextRectangleEnclosingRectangle()
        Finds the smallest rectangle containing all of the container's direct descendant rectangular container, including the spacing of the rectangles.
        Returns:
        the smallest child rectangle enclosing rectangle, or null is the container has no child rectangles

      • findDescendantEnclosingRectangle

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double findDescendantEnclosingRectangle()
        Finds the smallest rectangle containing all of the container's children, including the spacing of the children.
        Returns:
        the smallest children enclosing rectangle, or null is the container has no children with dimensions

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Description copied from class: Element
